column1: Many young sparrows have been born to us. They are proud of being Americans. They think they are cleverer than their parents
column4: are English. Pride is not right
column5: is it?There is a bird called the butcher-bird
column7: —that tries to kill us. We have to look out for these butcher-birds. But they cannot get into our houses: the doors are too small for them.There is a little bird called the snow-bird
column8: that comes in winter. We are not afraid of him. He is afraid of us. We drive him away when Emily feeds us all. Emily calls us naughty when we do this: she threatens to punish us for it.Emily and her folks live not far from our grove. Emily has a father and mother
column12: whose name is Nelly. Grandfather and Nelly are great friends. Grandfather brings Nelly in his arms to see Emily and Philip feed us.
